did.abstract: The collection contains the autograph books of Brooklyn residents Sue Gilmore, Miriam Miller, Frank Pergolizzi, Daisy, Martha, and Louise Baldwin, as well as the autograph book and wedding cards of Edna West, and an unidentified autograph book. They document the friendships and relationships of Brooklyn men and women from the mid 1870s to the 1920s, often containing personal notes and scraps documenting school life.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The autograph books primarily contain inscriptions from school friends, family, and sometimes simply a name and a date. As such, the autograph books frequently focus on school graduations and friendships formed during school. For instance, the autograph book of Miriam Miller contains a list of her fellow graduates at Bushwick High School and who was on the honor roll. Additionally the Edna West, Sue Gilmore, Frank Pergolizzi, and an unidentified autograph book contain inscriptions from friends and family.

While autograph books were popular in the 19th century, they were gradually phased out in favor of school yearbooks in the mid to late 20th century. This collection does not include autograph books focused on collecting the signatures of famous individuals.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: All works published prior to 1923 are in the public domain. The copyright status for all other materials has not been evaluated. Please consult library staff for more information.
